sen.j: 松平 宗発（本庄宗発、あるいは本荘宗発とも）（まつだいら むねあきら、天明2年7月2日 (旧暦)（1782年8月10日） - 天保11年8月25日 (旧暦)（1840年9月20日））は、江戸時代の大名、老中。
sen.e: Muneakira MATSUDAIRA (also known as Muneakira HONJO) (August 10, 1782 - September 20, 1840) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and a roju (member of shogun's council of elders) who lived during the Edo period.

Muneakira MATSUDAIRA (also known as Muneakira HONJO) (August 10, 1782 - September 20, 1840) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and a roju (member of shogun's council of elders) who lived during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Muneakira MATSUDAIRA (also known as Muneakira HONJO) (August 10, 1782 - September 20, 1840) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and a roju (member of shogun's council of elders) who lived during the Edo period.

sen.j: 丹後国宮津藩第5代藩主。
sen.e: The fifth lord of the domain of Miyazu in the Province of Tango.
The fifth lord of Miyazu Domain, Tango Province.
sen.cmt: Miyazu Domain, Tango Province.に訂正しました。
sen.e: The fifth lord of Miyazu Domain, Tango Province.
The eighth lord of the Honjo matsudaira family.
The eighth lord of the Honjo-Matsudaira family.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。Matsudairaに訂正しました。
sen.e: The eighth lord of the Honjo-Matsudaira family.
The third son of Suketsugu MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of the domain.
The third son of Suketsugu MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of the domain.
The third son of Suketsugu MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of the domain.
The younger brother of Munetada MATSUDAIRA, the forth lord of the domain.
The younger brother of Munetada MATSUDAIRA, the forth lord of the domain.
The younger brother of Munetada MATSUDAIRA, the forth lord of the domain.
Lawful wife was the daughter of Yasutomo MAKINO.
Lawful wife was the daughter of Yasutomo MAKINO.
Lawful wife was the daughter of Yasutomo MAKINO.

sen.j: 子に娘（西尾忠固正室）、娘（松平忠栄 (尼崎藩主)継室）、娘（青山幸礼正室）、娘（松平信宝 (上山藩主)継室）、娘（安藤信正正室）、娘（安部信任正室）、娘（久野純固室）、娘（中西元良室）。
sen.e: His children were daughters (the lawful wife of Tadakata NISHIO), (the second wife of Tadanaga MATSUDAIRA, the lord of the Amagasaki Domain), (the lawful wife of Yukinori AOYAMA), (the second wife of Nobumichi MATSUDAIRA, the lord of the Kaminoyama Domain), (the lawful wife of Nobumasa ANDO), (the lawful wife of Nobuyori ABE), (the lawful wife of Sumikata KUNO), and (the lawful wife of Motora NAKANISHI).

His children were daughters (the lawful wife of Tadakata NISHIO, the second wife of Tadanaga MATSUDAIRA who was the lord of the Amagasaki Domain, the lawful wife of Yukinori AOYAMA, the second wife of Nobumichi MATSUDAIRA who was the lord of the Kaminoyama Domain, the lawful wife of Nobumasa ANDO, the lawful wife of Nobuyori ABE, the lawful wife of Sumikata KUNO, and the lawful wife of Motora NAKANISHI).
sen.cmt: daughters の括弧書きをまとめました。
sen.e: His children were daughters (the lawful wife of Tadakata NISHIO, the second wife of Tadanaga MATSUDAIRA who was the lord of the Amagasaki Domain, the lawful wife of Yukinori AOYAMA, the second wife of Nobumichi MATSUDAIRA who was the lord of the Kaminoyama Domain, the lawful wife of Nobumasa ANDO, the lawful wife of Nobuyori ABE, the lawful wife of Sumikata KUNO, and the lawful wife of Motora NAKANISHI).

sen.j: 官位は従四位下、伯耆国守、侍従。
sen.e: Official court ranks were Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Hoki no kuni no kami (Governor of Hoki Province), and jiju (a chamberlain).
Official court ranks were Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Hoki no kuni no kami (Governor of Hoki Province), and jiju (a chamberlain).
Official court ranks were Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Hoki no kuni no kami (Governor of Hoki Province), and jiju (a chamberlain).

sen.j: 奏者番、寺社奉行、大坂城代、京都所司代を経て、老中に就任。
sen.e: After being sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle), and Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy), he assumed the position of roju (member of shogun's council of elders).

After being sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle), and Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy), he assumed the position of roju (member of shogun's council of elders).

After being sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle), and Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy), he assumed the position of roju (member of shogun's council of elders).

sen.j: 宗発死後、家督は養子の松平宗秀（4代藩主宗允の三男）が継いだ。
sen.e: After Muneakira's death, his adoptive child, Munehide MATSUDAIRA (the third son of Munetada, the fourth lord of the domain) succeeded the head of the family.
After Muneakira's death, his adoptive child, Munehide MATSUDAIRA (the third son of Munetada, the fourth lord of the domain) succeeded the head of the family.
After Muneakira's death, his adoptive child, Munehide MATSUDAIRA (the third son of Munetada, the fourth lord of the domain) succeeded the head of the family.

sen.j: 1808年（文化 (元号)5年） 宮津藩相続
sen.e: 1808: He succeeded the Miyazu Domain

1812: He took the position as sojaban.

sen.j: 1818年（文政元年） 寺社奉行兼任（8月24日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: September 24, 1818: He beban to serve an additional post as jisha-bugyo.
September 24, 1818: He beban to serve an additional post as jisha-bugyo.
September 24, 1818: He beban to serve an additional post as jisha-bugyo.

sen.j: 1826年（文政9年） 寺社奉行免、大坂城代就任（11月23日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: December 21, 1826: He was removed from the position of jisha-bugyo, and assumed the position of Osaka jodai.
December 21, 1826: He was removed from the position of jisha-bugyo, and assumed the position of Osaka jodai.
December 21, 1826: He was removed from the position of jisha-bugyo, and assumed the position of Osaka jodai.

sen.j: 1828年（文政11年） 大坂城代免、京都所司代就任（11月22日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: December 28, 1828: He was removed from the position of Osaka jodai, and assumed the position of Kyoto shoshidai.
December 28, 1828: He was removed from the position of Osaka jodai, and assumed the position of Kyoto shoshidai.
December 28, 1828: He was removed from the position of Osaka jodai, and assumed the position of Kyoto shoshidai.

sen.j: 1831年（天保2年） 京都所司代免、老中就任
sen.e: 1831: He was removed from the position of Kyoto shoshidai, and assumed the position of roju.
1831: He was removed from the position of Kyoto shoshidai, and assumed the position of roju.

1840: He died at the age of 59.
